p: We collected 98 nymphs and adults of L. tumana from Glacier National Park (GNP) and its environs in 2010 ( Fig 1). These samples were supplemented with 18 ‘historic’ individuals collected in 1997, 1998, and 2005 ( Table 1). All sampling was done under permit from the U.S. National Park Service. Samples were stored in 70–95% ethanol. The 16 sampled locations spanned the species’ known range, with locales separated by 0.3 to 44.3 km.
